s.text: But it makes no sense for a journalist to say, "I don't mind being censored, but only about information I wouldn't publish anyway."
It was by a former British intelligence officer (MI5?
It was by a former British intelligence officer (MI5?
It was by a former British intelligence officer (MI5?
A botched assassination attempt that killed innocents is just the kind of thing the citizens ought to know about, while the government won't want them to know.
A bomb intended for Qaddafi allegedly blew up the wrong car, killing innocent people.
to kill Muammar Qaddafi, the prominent Libyan statesman and murderer.

While others chase semen-stained cocktail dresses and sweat through the Beltway summer humidity in pursuit of leaks, we sit back in our breezy Pacific Northwest aerie, sipping a microbrew, observing, analyzing, synthesizing, and generally thinking great thoughts.
After all, if an American publication like Slate finds itself subject to Britain's Official Secrets Act, this turns the Internet's promise of freedom on its head.
